sen.j: 小倉家（おぐらけ）は、羽林家の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: Ogura family was a kuge (court noble) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
The Ogura family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
The Ogura family were kuge (court nobles) with kakaku (family status) of urinke (the fourth highest family status for court nobles).
Kanin line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They came under the Kanin line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan
They came under the Kanin line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 西園寺家一門の洞院家庶家。
sen.e: Branch family of the Toin family of the Saionji family group
They were a branch family of the Toin family of the Saionji family group
They were a branch family of the Toin family of the Saionji family group
Family business was kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrine).
Their family business was kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines).
Their family business was kagura (sacred music and dancing performed at shrines).
Its family crest is migi mitsudomoe (clockwise three comma-shaped figures in a circle).
Its family crest was migi mitsudomoe (clockwise three comma-shaped figures in a circle).
Its kamon (family crest) was migi mitsudomoe (clockwise three comma-shaped figures in a circle).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) in the Edo Period was 150 koku (approx. 27.1cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo Period was 150 koku (approx. 27.1cubic meters).
Karoku (hereditary stipend) during the Edo Period was 150 koku (approx. 27.1cubic meters).
After Meiji Restoration, viscount
After Meiji Restoration, they held the title viscount
After the Meiji Restoration, they held the title viscount.
sen.cmt: 文末にピリオドMeiji Restoratio→the Meiji Restoratio

sen.j: 鎌倉時代、山科実雄の二男、中納言小倉公雄が創設する
sen.e: The family was founded in the Kamakura Period by Kino OGURA, Chunagon (middle counselor), who was the second son of Jitsuo YAMASHINA.
The family was founded during the Kamakura Period by Kino OGURA, Chunagon (middle counselor), who was the second son of Jitsuo YAMASHINA.
The family was founded during the Kamakura Period by Kino OGURA, Chunagon (Vice-councilor of state), who was the second son of Jitsuo YAMASHINA.

sen.j: 明治維新後の明治17年7月8日小倉英季に子爵の位を授けられた。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration on July 8, 1884, the peerage of viscount was conferred on Hidesue OGURA.
After the Meiji Restoration on July 8, 1884, the peerage of viscount was conferred on Hidesue OGURA.
